issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
App fails to run on device using SDK: 3.2.3.v20140326144913
Note: However we can install app using iTunes. Working fine using iOS simulator

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Create a new project using above sdk
2) Try and run it on ios device

Actual Result:

{code}
[INFO] :   Invoking xcodebuild
[INFO] :   Image optimization complete
[INFO] :   Installing app on device: Global’s iPhone 5s
[ERROR] :  Failed to install app on device (0xe800002d)
[INFO] :   Project built successfully in 22s 900ms
{code}

Expected:
App must run without error.
fields.summary: iOS: Failed to install app on device
fields.environment:
OSX: 10.9.2
Xcode: 5.1
Appcelerator Studio: 3.2.3.201403250634
SDK: 3.2.3.v20140326144913
acs:1.0.14
alloy:1.3.1
npm:1.3.2
titanium:3.2.3-dev
titanium-code-processor:1.1.0
Device iPhone 5s 7.1 /iPod Touch 2 7.1

comments.body:
Hi Ingo, 
The issue did not occur for previous sdk. It occurred for 3.2.3.v20140326144913 sdk only.

Today its working fine with Environment:
OSX: 10.9.2
 Xcode: 5.1
 Appcelerator Studio: 3.2.3.201403271839
SDK: 3.2.3.v20140327115429
acs:1.0.14
alloy:1.3.1
 npm:1.3.2 
titanium:3.2.3-alpha2 
titanium-code-processor:1.1.1-alpha
 Device: iPhone 5c (7.1)

And really sorry about adding Priority instead of Severity by mistake. Will take care in future.

Thanks & Regards,
-Pragya
This bug is still present in Release 3.2.3.
[~s.stefanek] We've not been able to reproduce this since. Please give us the steps to reproduce and your build output so we can investigate.

it still happens with 3.3.0.GA .

It's random as said above.
We need additional information in order to be able to reopen it.

It's happenning to me quite often to.
I'm currently using a multiple Xcode configuration to support building old applications (changing my Xcode version suing xcode-select -s command).
I always solve this problem by unpluging / repluging the mobile device.

Alas this happens to me more often than it doesn't! :(

It has done so on every version of Ti since I first started testing on teh mac about a year ago (feb 2014)

Hi All, this is still happening for me regularly. Is there a fix or a workaround at least. No other clues given. Works fine in simulator. Happy to do elaborate workaround if necessary but I need app on device ASAP.

Thanks
